text: Thorstein Arthur Johansen (7 January 1888 - 2 August 1963) was a Norwegian rifle shooter who competed in the early 20th century. He participated in shooting at the 1920 Summer Olympics in Antwerp and won the gold medal in team 100 m running deer, double shots. He was also a member of the Norwegian trap team which finished seventh in the team clay pigeons event. ==References== ==External links== *profile Category:1888 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Norwegian male sport shooters Category:ISSF rifle shooters Category:Olympic shooters of Norway Category:Shooters at the 1920 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for Norway Category:Trap and double trap shooters Category:Olympic medalists in shooting Category:Medalists at the 1920 Summer Olympics
title: Thorstein Johansen
